TopicTitle: Is there anyway to get a "Maximized" window KSP?

Articles.Content: Hello there! I'm the type of person who likes the ability to be able to see other things on screen other than just a game. I'm wondering if there's any way, when using the windowed mode in KSP, to be able to "Maximize" the window (that center button between the X, and the Line center-most), that way I can see it without having to used borderless windows or fullscreen, and should the need arise, the ability to snap it with another window using windows 10's angle snap feature. Is there ANY way to do such?

@Rofl47

Found this with a google search. Might be what you're looking for(?)

http://westechsolutions.net/sites/WindowedBorderlessGaming/

Edited January 9, 2017 by Gianni1122

You can find the window size for KSP in the settings file, and it can be edited with a text edirot. I have manually adjusted the size to the values that fill the maximum screen space without covering the task bar

On 1/9/2017 at 8:50 AM, tomf said:

You can find the window size for KSP in the settings file, and it can be edited with a text edirot. I have manually adjusted the size to the values that fill the maximum screen space without covering the task bar

One of the default offerings is good enough for me.  A few extra pixels but I drag the top of the window a hair offscreen so the bottom lines up with the taskbar.  The missing pixels on top don't matter.
